page.title: 06THE ARBORETUM, LINCOLN.
page.content: The {Lincoln }Arboretum was opened in { 1872} to provide enjoyment for the " Working Classes " and to be an attraction for visitors. It covers an area of {14 acres}on a south sloping site and features lawns, flowerbeds, ornamental ponds with a fountain,a bandstand and a rose garden The fountain commemorates the turning on of the water supply from{Elkesley. This replaced the supply from{Harts- {holme Lake} which started the typhoid epidemic of{1904}when{130}people died. The{11}flowerbeds are planted annually and contain approximately{1000}plants each. These are tended by{3}gardeners where there used to be{ 9.}The gardeners find vandalism which is on the increase a real problem.It costs {Â£20}to replace a damaged tree.A tree census showed that there were{472 trees in total{(59% deciduous).
